Your answers to your questions are as follows:%0D%0A%0D%0A1. To follow the fashion of another culture like the west goes against the Shariah as the Prophet ((Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam)) said "Whosoever imitates a nation is of them." If your fashion is according to the Shariah and you are not imitating another nation or culture then only it will be permissible..%0D%0A%0D%0A2. According to the Shariah your action will be based according to your intention. Nabi (saw) said "Verily your deeds are judged by your intention...." So if you steal you may be punished by the law of the country but according to the shariah you would be judged by the intention.%0D%0A%0D%0A3. To answer this question I refer you to the above mentioned Hadith that your deed is judged by your intention and being a pillar of Islam you have no excuse to leave your Salaah and your father is fulfilling his part of the Shariah which is "Order your children at the age of 7 and beat them at the age of ten." Again you would be rewarded by your intention.%0D%0A%0D%0A4. All praise be to Allah that you have put Allah before your friend and this the requirement of the Shariah that you put Allah and his Rasool (saw) before everything else. You need not keep your friend away from your home you may show him the correct path and invite him to the correct Deen.
